msContents.summary: Image 1r: Explanation of the Trinity, written in an untrained hand, in Amharic. Large Psalter with Mahdar. Illuminations are added recently over the top of text. The midpoint of the Psalms is unmarked. Psalm 151 is the long version. Image 132l contains a prayer in thelower margin and the instruction: "pray three times." Song of Songs is the common version. Praises of Mary begins with Monday and culminates on Sunday. Image 154l contains a colophon mentioning the owner, ዘአፈ ክርስቶስ, his wife, ወላተ ዳዊት and the claim that he ordered it with his own means. Anyone who steals or cancels anything is condemned by the authority of Peter and Paul. Then, follows an asmat prayer for protection based on the five dolors. The book contains a red paper strip with the number 20 inside. Image 175l mentions ወለተ ጊዮርጊስ. Image 183l has a beautiful rhyming poem and prayer; and a scribal note at the end: "Finished. Let us rest." Images 184l-185r: Asmat prayers for protection from enemies and demons. Image 186l: pen trials. The book has been foliated in pencil in the lower right corner of each folio.
